content.description: Start on same low start holds as Slytherin, make a move left then heel hook the mantle on your right. Reach for a crimp and pull over the mantle. Easy slab to the top out.

Right-to-left climb up the deep crack/ledge with a topout on rough slopers. Sit-start using the juggy ledge as far down and right as you can go (start just right of the ledge to add an extra move and make it trickier). Use lots of heels and crosses to work your way up to the jugs over the lip. Use rough slopers and high feet to top out.Variations (see pic):- Sit-start from the next ledge further right and move into the standard start (V3) - Extreme sit-start all the way down in the cave with hands on the slightly protruding bar. Use toe/heel/bicycle to pull up the couple inches into the standard start holds (V5?)
content.location: Just above the Coffin - obvious line left of Dishy and Crown

content.description: Start with right hand on the good jagged crimp (used for left hand on start of Hufflepuff) and left hand on the obvious smaller crimp near it. Use bad feet to pull straight up to the two obvious edges, then match the bad sloper, then go match the ledge over the lip.
content.location: Just left of and partially overlapping Hufflepuff.

content.description: Sit-start with left on the jagged smile crimp and right wrapped on the obvious hold; right foot on the shelf. Pull up to the puffy loaf hold (probably the crux) and then go straight up to top out. Boulder to the right (the lower half of Slytherin) is off
content.protection: Spotter helps so you don't fly off the ledge
content.location: Right side of the face left of Slytherin.

content.description: Combines the four Harry Potter problems in a traverse and topout with some fun linking moves where the feet run out. Sit-start for Slytherin, then traverse left below the slopy lip until you get to the lip jug from Gryffindor. Top out from there same as Gryffindor
content.location: Left side of the upper strip boulder - Starts with Slytherin, ends with Gryffindor.

content.description: Sit-start with hands on the lowest strip-ledge and high right heel. Move up to the next ledge, then the jug right, and so on. Fun problem that's pretty smooth with certain beta
content.location: Just left of "Dishy". Various starting positions possible.

content.description: Leftmost of the upper strip and Harry Potter problems, this starts with a couple overhanging moves on good holds and then a frictiony topout. Stand-start matched on the ledge and then go straight up/slightly left. Getting purchase with hands for the topout is the crux. If you don't actually push off and out, a fall while topping out won't put you over the landing ledge.
content.location: Upper strip area just around the corner from Ravenclaw, etc... Standing right at the prow in the indented/eroding ground spot, start with both hands on the chest-height juggy shelf to pull on.

content.description: Good exercise for the skin on the fingers - this one's all about the start.
content.location: Sit start on two very rough slopers. You should see them as the areas the rock has been scrubbed quite a bit. Grab the first crimp, then the crown, then up and over. Stand-start variation is V1ish

content.description: SImilar to The Crown with a difficult sit-start and then easy moves up top.
content.location: Sit-start: Match the crack and get a very high left foot with right on anything you can find to balance. Pull up and cross your left hand to the dish hold. Match and then use the decent holds to head left and ascend the seam.Stand-start variation (start with dish) V1

content.description: Long strip with some traverses and interesting problems. Several hard problems that need to be cleaned to be doable
